title: El Puente: De la Ingeniería Biomédica a la IA
text: Como ingeniero biomédico, mi día a día suele estar rodeado de señales complejas: desde ritmos circadianos hasta imágenes de microscopía de fluorescencia. Entendí que la mejor forma de escalar el impacto de estas investigaciones es a través de la Inteligencia Artificial.

title: El Puente: De la Ingeniería Biomédica a la IA
text: Como ingeniero biomédico, mi día a día suele estar rodeado de señales complejas: desde ritmos circadianos hasta imágenes de microscopía de fluorescencia. Entendí que la mejor forma de escalar el impacto de estas investigaciones es a través de la Inteligencia Artificial.

title: El Puente: De la Ingeniería Biomédica a la IA
text:
Mis Proyectos Actuales
En este blog voy a documentar cómo estoy aplicando modelos de IA y herramientas de Python para: * CircaScope: Análisis automatizado de ritmos biológicos. * Backflip: Procesamiento avanzado de imágenes de microscopía.
Mi objetivo es demostrar que la ingeniería de IA no es solo código, sino entender el dominio de los datos.

title: Francisco Joaquín Tassara
text:
[cite_start]I am a Bioengineer and a Ph.C. in Biological Sciences with a solid foundation in mechatronics and computational analysis. My professional journey is driven by a fascination with complex biological data and a commitment to building intelligent tools to extract meaningful insights from it.
[cite_start]Currently, I am a doctoral researcher at the Behavioral Genetics Laboratory (Fundación Instituto Leloir), where I designed and constructed a single-objective light-sheet microscope for studying neuronal plasticity[cite: 9, 29, 30]. This project represents a convergence of optical engineering, hardware-software integration, and large-scale image processing.


[cite_start]As a Senior Teaching Assistant for Biomedical Signal and Image Processing at ITBA, I guide students through the complexities of analyzing biological data. [cite_start]I have also supervised undergraduate research projects that utilize AI methods for the segmentation and classification of microscopy images[cite: 53, 56].



My transition toward AI Engineering is highlighted by several key developments: * CircaScope: A Python-based GUI for the automated analysis of circadian rhythms. * Drosophila Sorter: A robotic system that integrates computer vision and mechatronics for automated biological sample classification. * Backflip: A software tool designed to optimize fluorescence microscopy image processing workflows.

title: Francisco Joaquín Tassara
text:
Technical Skills

[cite_start]Programming & Data Science: Python (scientific stack), Image Processing (OpenCV, napari), and Biomedical Signal Processing[cite: 47, 56].
[cite_start]Engineering & Hardware: Mechatronics, Control Systems, and Optical System Design[cite: 9, 11, 48].
[cite_start]Research & Analysis: In-vivo imaging, Behavioral Analysis, and Circadian Biology[cite: 21, 35].


I am actively seeking opportunities to apply my engineering background and scientific rigor to solve complex problems in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
